storyInfo: Wind Chimes must deliver a letter to Shiqiao Village–– a place that even she knows only by name.

attributes.content: Wind Chimes, Wind Chimes!
Phew, managed to catch you before you left town.
Ah Yun? What's wrong? Did I leave something at the post office?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: It's not that. The mandarins want a letter sent to Shiqiao Village.
attributes.name: Ah Yun

attributes.content: But none of the Messengers at the post office had ever heard of a place by that name, so they spent a while asking around.
attributes.name: Ah Yun

attributes.content: Not sure how this came up, but eventually someone said 'if Wind Chimes doesn't know, then I reckon nobody knows.'
attributes.name: Ah Yun

attributes.content: And that was just as you'd left.
attributes.name: Ah Yun

attributes.content: Got it. I'll take care of it.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Wind Chimes threw open her rucksack, revealing the various letters stuffed to the brim within.
Just throw the letter in there. I've heard of Shiqiao and roughly know which direction it's in, but I might have to ask for specifics along the way.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Where are you going after you finish your deliveries? Yumen or Lungmen?
attributes.name: Ah Yun

attributes.content: Lungmen. Lungmen's had a longer backlog of letters to be delivered to the mountain countryside than Yumen.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Then, I'll treat you to that new Mrs. Pepper ice cream that's been all over the ads when you get back. Apparently, they're going the spicy-and-savory route this time, and it's not sweet at all!
attributes.name: Ah Yun

attributes.content: But, isn't ice cream supposed to be sweet?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Pssh. When you get tired of eating sweets, you obviously go with something spicy. That's what's trendy these days.
attributes.name: Ah Yun

attributes.content: Leaving the on another delivery run?
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Mmhmm.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Go right on ahead then, no search needed. When I saw you taking every single letter out and neatly packing them back in, I felt a bit bad for inconveniencing you.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Appreciate it.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Oh, also, Old Cheung asked me to thank you for him.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Cheung?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: That bearded guy whose letters kept bouncing because his hometown was relocated.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: You delivered several dozen of his letters all at once, and when he got some replies back, he was so happy he started crying.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Oh, I remember now... It's not like I did anything special. Just part of my job.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Then, thank you for doing your job. You take care of yourself now!
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: After staying in a nomadic city for a while, people tend to forget that there is an 'outside'.
But, the 'outside' is actually pretty close. Close enough that if you walk a few li out towards the edge of the tracks, you'll come face-to-face with the wind and sand.
Thanks for your hard work on fixing up the Chidao!
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Oh, if it isn't the Messenger with the broken horn! What's up? Did we get mail? Is it for me, or some young lad or lass on our construction site?
attributes.name: Humble Worker

attributes.content: I do have mail, but it's just a stipend from Lungmen.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: A stipend, huh...?
attributes.name: Humble Worker

attributes.content: You don't seem too thrilled about it.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: No, of course I am! The whole point of comin' out here to work is to make life a little better! I'm just, a bit worried. It's been two months since we've gotten any letters from our village.
attributes.name: Humble Worker

attributes.content: I passed by the village just last month. Everyone was very nice.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: That's good to hear.
attributes.name: Humble Worker

attributes.content: Say, don't be in such a rush to leave. Stay here for dinner, and leave some time tomorrow.
attributes.name: Humble Worker

attributes.content: I have a lot of mail to deliver this time, so I think I should––
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Don't be shy, we're practically family here! Everyone's always looking forward to you coming around. It's mighty interesting hearing you talk about the cities.
attributes.name: Humble Worker

attributes.content: Since we got paid our stipends today, I'll have 'em get the food ready for you earlier, and find some youngsters for you to chat with!
attributes.name: Humble Worker

attributes.content: Next.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Leaving for work?
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Yes, work.
attributes.name: Well-Traveled Man

attributes.content: Please open your bag for security inspection.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Oh, right, there's something I wanted to ask.
attributes.name: Well-Traveled Man

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Did a Forte Messenger with a broken horn leave the city at about noon today? Would you mind telling me which way she went?
attributes.name: Well-Traveled Man

attributes.content: 'Jianzi... rumian... I'm in Lungmen...'
attributes.name: Impatient Villager

attributes.content: Ah Fang, you know how to read, don't you? C'mere and help me figure out what this says.
attributes.name: Impatient Villager

attributes.content: What is this thing anyway, a flashlight? I already have one at home. Why would they need to send one out from Lungmen?
attributes.name: Exhausted Villager

attributes.content: Auntie, that's not a flashlight, it's a telescope!
attributes.name: Young Villager

attributes.content: What's this?
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: It's a camera. I use it to document everyone's lives.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: You mean, the stuff they use to make TV shows?
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: Uhh... close enough?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Then, I'd better clean myself up and make a good impression...
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: Other people always say you become numb after working for too long. They say this is true for everything else as well, that everything becomes normal once you've been through it enough.
But when I go back and forth between the mountains and the cities, what I deliver most is letters back home.
There's hardly any difference between this month's letters and last month's. Just a few extra days of rain, a few extra bushels of wheat harvested.
But as long as their home remains, people will continue to write letter after letter.
Oh right, would you happen to know how to get to Shiqiao Village?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: I only know that it's somewhere to the north, but don't know the exact location...
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Shiqiao? Can't say I've ever heard of it. Want me to try asking around?
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: I'd appreciate it.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Sorry, but we don't know either.
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: But, apparently there's a lad in Bianti who came from Shiqiao, seeking shelter with his relatives. He might know the way.
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: Bianti Village? Sounds good. I happen to have mail to deliver there as well.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: You're not going to stay awhile?
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: Not this time. See you around!
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Hey you, old timer!
attributes.name: Suspicious Man

attributes.content: Hmm? What's wrong?
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: Wait, who are you? I haven't seen you around here before.
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: The Messenger that was here just now, did she say she was going to Shiqiao?
attributes.name: Suspicious Man

attributes.content: Yes, but... Hey, are you just gonna leave without saying anything?
attributes.name: Curious Villager

attributes.content: My home is close to Shiqiao. I'll lead her there!
attributes.name: Suspicious Man

attributes.content: A boy from Shiqiao...? Wait, do you mean Ah Liang?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Villager

attributes.content: Get over here, Ah Liang! Someone here needs directions!
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Villager

attributes.content: Head north, then about ten li after reaching Beifen, there's a big tree several arms' length 'round. Enter the mountains from there.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: After turning around, there'll be a two-way trail. Follow it all the way to the right for about a day...
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Alright, got it.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: You can memorize something that complicated?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Villager

attributes.content: Actually... Following the trail to the left leads you to my hometown.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: I'll just say this, you look just like one of us country folks, like you're right outta the mountains.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Villager

attributes.content: By the way, how's your hometown doing? Has everything been alright?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Villager

attributes.content: It's deserted. Everyone's already moved into the city for work.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: *sigh*... The last few years have been tough, and our village has been through similar, but at least we've managed to survive. Be careful out there.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Villager

attributes.content: Excuse me, that Messenger just now–
attributes.name: Crafty Man

attributes.content: Did you have some business with her?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Villager

attributes.content: I'm also trying to get to Shiqiao Village. I heard you folks talking about it from the distance, but I didn't catch everything...
attributes.name: Crafty Man

attributes.content: There's Beifen.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Two letters to be delivered here in Beifen, then one last letter... to Shiqiao.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Why are there so many people gathering here?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: They're all here to... read the announcement?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Yeah, our village's finally gettin' relocated. There's a new nomadic plate that's lookin' for workers, and they say anyone who helps build it can help keep it runnin' after the plate's been completed.
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: If the notice has been posted, doesn't that mean the convoy's probably ready to pick us up in a few days?
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: What about your mail...?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Just hand it over to me. I'll make sure to pass it out when everyone gets back. Really appreciate you bringing us our letters all these years.
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: ...You're welcome.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Huh? What are you still headin' north for?
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: I have one last letter addressed to Shiqiao.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Shiqiao Village?
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: They were supposed to get relocated last month. Dunno if anyone's there anymore.
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: Are you... absolutely certain about that?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Certain I saw the news. It was nailed up on the announcement board. The convoy also went into the mountains a few days ago, but we haven't seen any cars leavin'...
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: I might still be able to make it then.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: I wouldn't, if I were you. It's a long ways out, you don't even know if there'll be anyone there, and you might even get robbed–
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: Huh? Where'd she go?
attributes.name: Rushed Villager

attributes.content: I appreciate the tip, but I need to get going. There should still be enough time!
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: As the sun sets, the mountains stretch out along both sides of the narrow road.
Just past ten li north, I saw the dead tree. I followed a few bends and went into the mountains, climbing over peaks and ridges until I reached a fork in the road.
This is the way I went out, back in the day, but this time...
Excuse me, you're in the way.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Sorry, but we're here for the letter.
attributes.name: Suspicious Man

attributes.content: I don't have anything addressed to you in this bag.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Is that so? Well, I heard you had something for Shiqiao. The village is just ahead, so hand it over and I'll deliver it for you.
attributes.name: Suspicious Man

attributes.content: I'm good.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Hmph, so you wanna play hardball, huh?
attributes.name: Suspicious Man

attributes.content: Hand the letter over. It's just one piece of paper. Stop wasting time and bring it here!
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Make me.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Oh, you have the guts to challenge us? Think you're hot shit, huh?
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Have we met before?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Cut the crap! The boss ain't around this time, so don't expect us to show any mercy!
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Your stance looks pretty good by-the-books, but let's see if your blade has ever tasted blood...
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Gah!
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: You're pretty quick on your feet––
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: Hyah!
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Shit, this wench means business!
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: What are you afraid of? She can't take all of us at once!
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Why's a little errand runner putting her life on the line? You sure as hell don't know what's good for you.
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: (Pants) ...I have nothing to say to you.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: (Whispers) Laoge, she's not backing down. Maybe we ought to...
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: (Whispers) Hmph, that's our only option now.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Why don't we all take a step back? I'll tell you exactly why we can't let you through, and then you decide whether or not it's worth fighting us.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Do you know whose letter you're delivering? Our boss sent it after he got arrested.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Shiqiao is the boss's hometown, and that place has been deserted for a long while now. If not for the fact that you were going around where it was, we wouldn't have had eyes on you.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: As if I'd believe you.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Sure, so we fight you to the death over a piece of paper from who-knows-where. Does that even make any sense?
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Lemme give it to you straight: before he got caught, the boss hid some treasure. If he went through all the trouble to send that from Lungmen, there's gotta be something big inside.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: So hand over the letter, and when we find the treasure, we'll split it with you.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: In your dreams.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Alright, then. Let me just tell you one more thing. We were the ones who saved your life. Your horn wasn't broken back then, and you weren't carrying that blade on your back.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: You what–?!
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Does that jog your memory?
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: You're... those first group of robbers that I met? The ones who blindfolded me and burned my letters?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Who else?
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: If not for the fact that the boss didn't wanna cause extra trouble and felt sorry for the pitiful little girl who lost her family, you think taking the head of a mandarin is some big deal?
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Pitiful? What about that is pitiful?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Heh, do you actually think we had any pity for you?
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Any thieves worth their salt are already striking it rich in some nomadic city. If we had somewhere to go, you think we'd be camping out in these barren mountains to rob people?
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: You might even call this destiny, that you're here again delivering the boss' letter. Now that we're meeting again after so many years, let's not make this an ugly occasion.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: (Shakes head) If you really think this is destiny, you'd best get out of my way.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: What, don't you speak Yanese?
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: I bought this blade after you robbed me. Don't make me use it on you.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: You heard her, boys. Since you've got a death wish, don't blame us for what happens next.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: You'd dare?!
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: ––Hyaaah!
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: She's protecting that bag! Stab her in the back!
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: Her reactions are pretty quick...
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: You'd best... leave while you can. Those two back there aren't fatally injured. You could save them.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: We've already given you the bottom line. If you're not gonna cooperate, we can't let you leave here alive.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Your legs have gone weak, girl. Behave yourself and hand over that letter. Come with us, and you might even make yourself a fortune.
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: Don't... even think about it...
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Look at you. You can't even finish a sentence––
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: Urkh...
attributes.name: Crafty Robber

attributes.content: I was aiming... for your arm. Don't expect... the same courtesy next time.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Not bad. A single Messenger managed to take down three of us. But, that's the best you can do. Put your blade down.
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: I said, put your blade down!
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: What the hell? You brought backup?!
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Run, run!
attributes.name: Arrogant Robber

attributes.content: Are you alright?
attributes.name: Well-Traveled Man

attributes.content: I... I'll manage. Who are you?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: That letter...
attributes.name: Well-Traveled Man

attributes.content: Wind Chimes takes a step back.
Sorry, I got ahead of myself. Here's my ID.
attributes.name: Well-Traveled Man

attributes.content: The L.G.D.?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Long story short, I have some work to take care of, and I'd like your cooperation. Come back with me to Lungmen, and wait for us to finish inspecting this letter before you send it out.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: What's the deal... with this letter?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: This letter was sent by a bandit leader we had in custody. He said it was a letter home to his mother in Shiqiao Village.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: We looked into his claim and found that he indeed was from Shiqiao. By the way, the first crime he confessed to was robbing you.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: The guy's never been back home since he left, and it's been over a decade. Given that he doesn't have much time left, we didn't really try to stop him.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: He hasn't been back home in a decade?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: He claimed it was to avoid getting his family involved, but as for the actual reason... Who knows?
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Unfortunately, at around the same time you left town, we discovered that he had been involved in a rash of related cases.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: And so we had to consider the possibility that what he sent wasn't a letter to home, but rather a message.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: But... I'm almost there. What are the odds that this whole thing is a misunderstanding and it really is just an ordinary letter to home?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: I followed you all the way here just to confirm that.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Sir, if you follow this fork to the right, it'll take you to Shiqiao. If you follow it to the left, it'll take you to my hometown... But, you won't find anything there anymore.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Shiqiao will be relocated soon. I still know where to address my letters home, but this man...
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Do we have to go back to Lungmen?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: *sigh*... If you're dead set on not going back, then I suppose I can inspect the letter right here.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: But, if there really is some funny business going on with this letter, or if something happens to me, you'll be held liable.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: That's fine.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Even though that guy robbed you?
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: This has nothing to do with that case, but...
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Someone who's been away from home that long, and won't ever be able to go back... I want to believe that his last letter was just an ordinary letter home.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Alright then.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Does that camera of yours work? If so, I'd like you to take pictures of the entire inspection process.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: ...And, done.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: So... What's the story...?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: The man folds the letter neatly, stuffs it back inside the envelope, and then hands the envelope back to me with a pat on the shoulder.
Go ahead and send it where it belongs.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: I know that on the other side of this mountain lies more mountains, and that when the convoy from Shiqiao sets out, they'll at best meet me head-on. But, I can't slow down.
It feels as if I'm rushing to meet the last of my neighbors who still haven't moved.
If I arrive earlier, we'll be able to sit down together for a chat over a cup of tea. Any later, and I'll only be able to catch the sight of their backs.
*pant*, *pant*... Finally made it...
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Who might you be, girl? Are you here to see off your relatives?
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: No, I'm... a Messenger. I have a letter to Shiqiao from Lungmen...
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Lungmen? It mustn't have been easy coming all the way out here. Let me see that letter, and I'll ask the people who've already boarded.
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: Well, that's unfortunate. This letter seems to be addressed to Aunt Zhao.
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: Unfortunate?!
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Don't panic. It's not what you think. Aunt Zhao is fine. She's old and a bit addled, but otherwise fine.
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: The villagers made an agreement that everyone would leave together once the convoy arrived, but now she's refusing to leave, throwing a childish fit and saying we lied to her.
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: I'm not sure if she'll be able to read your letter.
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: Regardless, let's get it delivered to her first.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: ...Auntie?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Who's there? Who is it this time? I said, I'm not leaving! I don't care about nomadic cities or telephones or intercity nets– it's all a scam!
attributes.name: Addled Elder

attributes.content: You're all trying to trick me into leaving, just like you tricked Erya! I'm not going anywhere!
attributes.name: Addled Elder

attributes.content: I'm not here to ask you to leave. I simply came to deliver a letter–
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: I'm not leaving! I'd rather die than leave! I'm just going to wait right here... I don't like sweets!
attributes.name: Addled Elder

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Who are you? How'd you get into my house?
attributes.name: Addled Elder

attributes.content: I'm a Messenger, Auntie. I've come to deliver a message from your son–
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: I don't know how to read, and I've been lied to and cheated my whole life... But, what's the use? Erya knew how to read and write, but he was cheated all the same...
attributes.name: Addled Elder

attributes.content: I believe Erya wrote this letter for you.
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Letter...? What letter? He's never written home before...
attributes.name: Addled Elder

attributes.content: How about this: I'll read his letter for you, okay?
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.content: Read the letter... for me?
attributes.name: Addled Elder

attributes.content: Yes, please.
attributes.name: Addled Elder

attributes.content: 'I'm sorry, Ma. I haven't been back home in more than ten years. I haven't even sent a single letter...'
attributes.name: Wind Chimes

attributes.text: I'm sorry, Ma. I haven't been back home for more than ten years. I haven't even sent a single letter.
I don't want to be a burden on you, and I also don't know what I should even write.
I went down the wrong path and hurt a lot of people. I've been living in a stupor the last few years, as if I've gotten terribly sick.
People say that you have to choose your own path, and can only rely on yourself. But, I'd rather rely on the hawkers who'd come to the village. You could always trust them to bring ice cream.
It was so sweet, Ma. Even after all these years, I still remember that taste. Whatever that stuff was labeled 'ice cream' on the outside, how could anything be so sweet and so delicious?
I used to love jujubes. But after that, I wouldn't even touch the biggest, reddest jujubes. I just wanted to eat ice cream.
You scolded me back then. Said I was acting like I was possessed. Maybe I really was possessed, and ended up ran away from home over some ice cream.

When I first made some cash of my own, I immediately went and bought a whole box of ice cream with all sorts of different flavors. But, I ate until my stomach was upset, but still couldn't taste that same maddening sweetness.
Now that everything's said and done, I don't think I'll ever be able to go home again. But, don't worry about me. I'll be fine.

If you really miss me, just go plant a jujube tree behind the house and pretend that it's me. In the spring, when the tree sprouts new leaves, that means I've woken up. In the autumn, when the jujubes fall to the ground, it's me who ate them.
If the thorns on the jujube tree prick you, it means I'm throwing a fit. You can hit me or scold me, but my roots will always be there. I won't go anywhere. I'll always be with you.
I guess that's it. Think of that as me coming back home.

attributes.content: When I get to the end of the letter, I have to grit my teeth to keep myself from crying. But, the old woman simply turns around, slowly making her way to the backyard.
There is already a carefully tended tree in the center of the courtyard, covered with jujubes both green and red.
The old woman slaps her palm down between the branches and leaves of the jujube tree, and the sharp thorns dig into her hand. Tears crawl down her wrinkled face.
After a moment of silence, she turns around and heads in the direction of the convoy.
